intro: Campylospermum andongense, commonly known as the Andong campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
